required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of "VS002A" With the Standard WHO-ORS in Non-cholera Acute Watery Diarrhea in Infants and Young Children
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial to Compare the Efficacy and Safety of a Multiple Amino-acid Based ORS "VS002A" With the Standard WHO-ORS in the Management of Non-cholera Acute Watery Diarrhea in Infants and Young Children

collaborator.agency: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized double blinded clinical trial comparing amino acid based oral rehydration solution/medical food and glucose-based oral rehydration solution is infectious diarrhea in pediatric population

primary_outcome.description: number of hours of diarrhea after randomization

secondary_outcome.description: Stool output in the 1st 24 hours of hospitalization (g/kg body wt.), divided into two 12-hour periods
Total amount of stool output during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: ORS intake in the 1st 24 hours of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of intervention drink consumed in the first 24 hours after randomization
Amount of intervention drink consumed throughout the duration of the study
Frequency of IV fluids between he 2 groups
Frequency of treatment failures between the two groups
Amount and frequency of vomiting between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight (between pre-randomization and post-treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight at randomization and post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine output in the 1st 24 hours of hospitalization (g/kg body wt.)
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of urine in the first 24 hours after randomization
Stool culture and recording of infectious agent causing the diarrhea

arm_group.description: Amino acid based ORS/medical food (VS002A). Initial treatment dosing with VS002A will be estimated using body weight in accordance with 5-10 ml/kg after each loose stool as per icddr,b guidelines, to maintain ongoing loss.
Standard WHO-ORS. Initial treatment dosing with WHO-ORS will be estimated using body weight in accordance with 5-10 ml/kg after each loose stool as per icddr,b guidelines, to maintain ongoing loss.

intervention.description: WHO Oral rehydration solution, which is glucose based

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Age: 6 months - 36 months,
2. Duration of diarrhea â‰¤48 hours,
3. Some dehydration (judged clinically according to the "Dhaka method"),
4. Written informed consent by either parent/guardian.
Exclusion criteria:
1. Severe malnutrition (Weight-for-length WLZ/WHZ/WAZ <-3 or presence of nutritional edema)
2. Patients with diarrhea due to cholera.
3. Systemic illness (e.g. Pneumonia, tuberculosis, enteric fever, meningitis etc.)
4. Bloody diarrhea
5. Any congenital anomaly or disorder (e.g. diagnosed inborn error of metabolism, congenital cardiac disease, seizure disorders, hypothyroidism, Down's syndrome etc.)
6. Requirement of additional intravenous fluids after being provided with an IV for 4 hours on admission if severely dehydrated
7. Has documentation of taking antibiotic and/or antidiarrheal within the last 48 hours prior to hospitalization.

eligibility.gender_description: Measuring stool output on a diaper on female children will create a bias since it will be mixed with urine.

overall_official.affiliation: International Centre for Diarrhoeal Disease Research, Bangladesh
